intro: Monochasma monantha, commonly known as the single-stemmed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its inflorescence consists of a single spikelet, which is a defining feature of the species. Monochasma monantha is notable for its simplicity in structure and its ecological role in stabilizing soil in arid environments.
